{"step_by_step_thinking": "The pediatrician is conducting a case series study, which is a descriptive study that follows a group of patients who have a similar diagnosis or who are undergoing the same procedure over a certain period of time. Case series can be retrospective or prospective. They do not contain control groups and therefore cannot test hypotheses or calculate odds ratios. They also do not allow for the study of different interventions with two or more variables. Participants do not act as their own controls in a case series.", "answer_choice": "B"}
